p: The methoxydecane tree was identified as a new species of Boswellia, named Boswellia occulta Thulin, DeCarlo & S. P. Johnson, and described in [ 38]. It shows a highly distinct morphology from Boswellia carteri: B. occulta has glabrous, compound leaves and smooth gray bark, in contrast to the pubescent, compound leaves and exfoliating bark of B. carteri (see Figure 1, Figure 2, Figure 3 and Figure 4).
